ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and those speeding along with ease,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And those who move (on the water) gently,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: by the ships which smoothly sail on the oceans,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Then by oath of those which move with ease.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And those that glide with ease (upon the sea)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and those speeding along with ease,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And the ships that glide with ease.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: by [the ships] which move gently [on the sea];
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And those that flow with ease and gentleness;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And (the ships) that float with ease and gentleness;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [51:3] and those that run, the ships that run upon the surface of the water, with ease (yusran is a verbal noun functioning as a circumstantial qualifier, that is to say, muyassaratan);
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And those that glide with ease (upon the sea)) and He swears by the ships which easily sail on the sea, 609
